wikipedia_page.main: George Knox Anderson JP (1854 – 19 March 1941) was briefly the Conservative Member of Parliament (MP) for Canterbury.

link_mentions.page: List of United Kingdom MPs: A

response: * George Knox Anderson (1854–1941), Conservative MP for Canterbury, 1918
*George Knox Anderson, Conservative 1918 Canterbury by-election 113 days 3

The Canterbury by-election of 1918 was held on 9 August 1918.  The by-election was held due to the death of the incumbent Conservative MP, Francis Bennett-Goldney.  It was won by the Conservative candidate George Knox Anderson who was unopposed due to a War-time electoral pact.
